net.hudup.listener

Class BindServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.listener.BindServer

  • public class BindServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the model of remote power server together with remote information (host, port, access account, access password, etc.) that are bound to listener or balancer. Such remote power server is often called bound server. This BindServer can be identified with bound server because it actually is a wrapper of bound server. Listener or balancer is represented by the interface ServerStatusListener. Note, listener or balancer is implementation of ServerStatusListener interface. Listener or balancer dispatches incoming requests to the bound server and receives responses from the bound server. The variable server is such bound server and the variable rInfo contains remote information relevant to the bound server. Listener or balancer stores a list of bound servers; such list is represented by BindServerList.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

      Fields

      protected ServerStatusListener bind
      ServerStatusListener is an abstract model of listener or balancer.

      protected PowerServer server
      The bound server.

    • Field Detail

      • rInfo

        protected RemoteInfo rInfo
        Remote information (host, port, access account, access password, etc.) relevant to the bound server server.

      • server

        protected PowerServer server
        The bound server. It is often remote power server.

      • bind

        protected ServerStatusListener bind
        ServerStatusListener is an abstract model of listener or balancer. As usual, this variable refers to a concrete listener or balancer.

    • Method Detail

      • unbind

        public void unbind()
        Unbind the remote bound server. After this method is called, this BindServer is void.

      • getServer

        public PowerServer getServer()
        Getting the remote server.
        Returns:
        remote server referred by the internal variable server.

      • getRemoteInfo

        public RemoteInfo getRemoteInfo()
        Getting the remote information.
        Returns:
        remote information referred by the internal variable rInfo.

      • isBound

        public boolean isBound()
        Testing whether the remote server is bound. In current implementation, remote server is bound if the internal variable server is not null.
        Returns:
        whether remote server is bound.

      • bind

        public static BindServer bind(java.lang.String host,
                              int port,
                              java.lang.String account,
                              java.lang.String password,
                              ServerStatusListener bind)
        This static method creates a BindServer object that binds a remote server via specified host, port, access account, and access password. The ServerStatusListener interface, which often refers to listener or balancer, is also specified by the input parameter bind.
        Parameters:
        host - specified host.
        port - specified port.
        account - specified access account.
        password - specified access password.
        bind - ServerStatusListener interface often refers to listener or balancer.
        Returns:
        BindServer that binds the remote server via specified host, port, account, and password.

      • bind

        public static BindServer bind(RemoteInfo rInfo,
                              ServerStatusListener bind)
        This static method creates a BindServer object that binds a remote server via remote information. The ServerStatusListener interface, which often refers to listener or balancer, is also specified by the input parameter bind.
        Parameters:
        rInfo - remote information often contains host, port, access account, and access password
        bind - ServerStatusListener interface often refers to listener or balancer.
        Returns:
        BindServer that binds a remote server via remote information.
